text:
"Leave me alone. I decided this a long time ago. I want to be by myself. Forget about me. When I can, I’ll come back or I’ll ask for you. If you love me, let me go, or I might start to hate you. Goodbye!"

"Please, Rodya, come back to us! Let’s be like we used to be!" his mother cried, worried.

He slowly walked to the door. Dounia caught up with him.

"Brother, what are you doing to mother?" she whispered, angry.

He looked at her blankly. "I’ll come back... I’m coming," he mumbled and left the room.

"Selfish, heartless person!" Dounia shouted.

"He’s not heartless, he’s just lost his mind! Can’t you see? You’re being cruel!" Razumihin whispered to her, holding her hand tightly. "I’ll be back soon," he yelled to their mother, then ran out of the room.

Raskolnikov was waiting for him at the end of the hall.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov expresses a desire to be alone and cut ties with his family, fearing that their love will lead to hatred.
